name: Khana Ratsadon Coup d'Ã©tat
description: "...The King governs without principle. The country is left to the mercy of fate, as demonstrated by the current depression and hardship... The People's Party has no wish to snatch the throne, hence it invites the King to retain the position. But he must adopt a constitution to legitimately govern the country..."\n- excerpt from the Khana Ratsadon Manifesto

name: Prajadhipok's Reforms
description: The ongoing economic crisis offers the perfect opportunity to enact new reforms, as the old guard and nobility within our nation will be panicking and willing to support our initiatives... or will they?

name: Formation of the Ratthasapha
description: To aid with the modernisation of [SIA.GetSIAshortname] we must begin to reform the inefficient bureaucracy that was formed during the period of absolute monarchy. The Anantasamakhom Throne Hall has been deemed a suitable location for the new Ratthasapha (parliament) building and will allow more people to participate in the development of [SIA.GetSIAshortname].

name: Half-Leaf Democracy
description: The strong guiding hand of the monarch over the nation is required in order to counter the ever approaching syndicalist tide. By granting more power to the King and allowing him to appoint the Prime Minister, alongside immunity from persecution through the law, we can guarantee stability in the long run. This will, however, dissatisfy the liberals.

name: Tour the Nation
description: In order to better learn about our subjects and the problems they face, and to increase their trust in the monarchy, the King shall personally tour the nation.

name: Royal Project Foundation
description: A commission, which shall be called the Royal Project Foundation, must be created in order to monitor and receive feedback concerning the issues facing the common people.

name: A Devoted Monarchy
description: By working closely with our subjects towards further agrarian and development we've managed to gain the support of those living in rural areas. This will serve as a deterrent against the red phantom haunting our government.

name: Yellow Cover Dossier
description: Luang Praditmanutham (Pridi Panomyong) has drawn up somewhat socialist proposals aiming to resolve the inequality problem within [SIA.GetAdjective] society, he has so far enjoyed popular support from the peasants. The nobility are vehementaly objecting to this plan. Perhaps a deal with the devil can guarantee the safety of our nation from the syndicalist menace?

name: Nationwide Land Reform
description: Much land owned by the nobility lies fallow across the country, serving no purpose. We may be able to rapidly increase productivity by redistributing these lands to unlanded peasantry. This will, however, provoke the land's owners.

name: The Five Year Plan
description: Amibitious long-term plans have been drawn up for industrial development and infrastructure construction in rural areas, this will put us well on the road to becoming a Siwilai (civilised) nation.

name: State Welfare
description: By providing welfare to our citizens, through the use of state funds, we can ensure that all of the [SIA.GetAdjective] people will receive access to proper medical care, education, and other support. This will, however, come with the trade off of high taxes which will alienate the capitalists.

name: A Liberal [SIA.GetSIAshortname]!
description: Savaeng Piampongsarn, a graduate from Rayong who studied law, is currently the leader of the liberal/progressive faction within the Ratthasapha. Taking inspiration from the Japanese-style of democracy during the Taisho era, he has promised to deliver the people both peace and prosperity.

name: Land of the Free!
description: Having emerged victorious from the election, one of Piampongsarn's first initiatives is to enact a policy that will promote equal rights within the nation and recognise the Laotian, Mon, Malay, Chinese, and Cambodian peoples; alongside the native [SIA.GetAdjective] people.

name: A New [SIA.GetAdjective] Society
description: Additional classes concerning the civic duties of each citizen have been added to the national curriculum and are now compulsory, ensuring that every citizen can fully and equally participate in Piampongsarn's vision of a democratic society.

name: Progressive Measures
description: The progressives have enacted measures which give women the right to vote, alongside mandating that their pay be equal to that of their male counterparts. The regulation of monopolies and corporations through the use of anti-trust laws has also been implemented in order to promote equal competition and discourage monopolies.

name: A Modern [SIA.GetAdjective] Nation
description: Our nation has progressed rather far from what it once was. We are no longer a nineteenth century backwater but are, in fact, a modernised nation at the forefront of progress. This does not mean we shall stop here, we will continually strive to better ourselves and the nation. Long live [SIA.GetName]!

name: The Iron Marshal
description: Luang Phibunsongkhram, who gained fame during the [SIA.GetAdjective] intervention in Burma, now faces the monumental task of keeping the nation together and safe from the dissident threat.

name: Nationalisation of Foreign Industries
description: [SIA.GetSIAshortname] will need everything she can get in order to stand up on her own in this ever turbulent world. We will either purchase all foreign factories within our nation or, if left with no other choice, seize them by force. These factories shall be nationalised and used to help further our industrialisation programme.

name: Yuwachon Taharn
description: The Yuwachon Taharn (Youth Militia) is a reserve officer cadet training programme, which aims to better the combat performance of new recruits. By ensuring that every able-bodied men understands how to properly wield and use a rifle we can increase the quality of our army.

name: The Ratthaniyom Decrees
description: Thaification policies have already begun to take effect. Thai script is now standardised for usage; Betel chewing has been banned; the central Thai language is being enforced in schools nationwide and Chinese/Muslim schools who have not been compliant with our demands have been shut down. In addition the new national anthem is being promoted to further the new Thai identity.

name: Reapproach the Monarchy
description: Following the assassination of Luang Phibunsongkhram, Sarit Thanarat has managed to take control over both the armed forces and the government in quick succession. In order to move towards his ideal of Patiwat (revolution) and institute the guiding principle of "Phokhun". Thanarat views reconciliation with the Chakri dynasty as essential, as the monarchy must serve the role of moral guidance.

name: Creation of the Republic
description: Following the assassination of Luang Phibunsongkhram, Phao Sriyanond has managed to take control over both the armed forces and the government in quick succession. Viewing the monarchy as an archaic relic, and disliking the status of the monarchy during Phibunsongkhram's tenure, Sriyanond believes that the old system should be discarded in favour of a republic.

name: Buddhist Traditions
description: The promotion Theravada Buddhism as the national religion, in order to further national unity, shall begin with the establishment of a single Supreme Patriarch for both the Mahanikai and Thammayutthanikai sects; alongside the minority of Mahayana Buddhists within the nation. This will, however, dissatisfy the Muslims who reside in the south.

name: Lessons of the Civil War
description: The toll taken on [SIA.GetSIAshortname] from the civil war has surpassed even the Burmese invasion of Ayutthaya in 1765, it is clear that we must learn from this mess if we are to further ourselves as a nation.

name: The Prestigious Senate
description: The Wutthisapha (Senate), which bares a close resemblance to the British House of Lords, has been introduced with the intention of allowing the King to appoint loyal and experienced advisers. This will also allow him to halt the passage of some of the more radical bills proposed by elements within the government.

name: Privy Council Reforms
description: With the Supreme Council of State possessing the ability to dictate the King's policies from behind-the-scenes, perhaps we should look into reforming the old Privy Council? This would allow us to bring in like-minded figures to jockey for influence against the nobility, potentially dethroning them as the true power in our nation.

name: Empower the Nobility
description: By modernising the outdated nobility system into one that is based off of the ideals of meritocracy, as opposed to simply abolishing it, we may be able to achieve our dream of bringing about a more efficient bureaucratic system.

name: Father Governs Children
description: We will harken back to the Sukothai era, the reign of the benevolent King Ramkamhaeng the Great, by allowing our subjects to voice their issues directly to the Privy Council. This will have the added bonus of assisting with the resolution of several issues in a much more efficient manner.

name: Rise from the Ashes
description: We must undertake a broad and sweeping construction programme, in order to restore not only the nation itself but the spirit of our people as well. We will honour the sacrifices made by our allies and all of those who had rallied behind us during our darkest hour.

name: Issuing Amnesties
description: From the brutality of the civil war we have seen that we need to unify the people to guide the nation through this period of calamity. Therefore we have decided to grant amnesty to the officers who fought against us. While this may result in some unrest these traitorous officers continue to remain important to us, thus their assistance is necessary.

name: Military Purges
description: The turbulant upheavals of the civil war have taught us that traitors are behind every corner and must be rooted out, thus we shall rid ourselves of all of the officers who fought against us. While this will negatively affect our operational capacity their deaths will allow us to consolidate power in the long run.

name: Ensuring Loyalty
description: In order to avoid the possibility of a rebellious military we must ensure that the surviving armed forces are loyal to both the government and the people, not subversive outsiders and revolutionaries

name: The People's Assembly
description: How can it be that in the twentieth century ours remains a feudal nation? Inspired by the heroic revolutionaries of France, past and present, we shall establish a new government that will root out the aristocracy for the proletariat and peasants.

name: Our Faith in the Star
description: To ensure that our revolution truly bears fruit we must spread our doctrine to the masses, and bring them the hope and assurance of a brighter future ahead. The red star must shine bright and help guide them through these gloomy times.

name: New [SIA.GetAdjective] Order
description: The Krating Daeng (Red Gaurs) Paramilitary Group has been created by the government, in order to root out the remaining opposition of capitalists and nobles. Once we are rid of them we can surely transition to more peaceful ways.

name: Arunothai
description: In order to ensure the protection of the new system we must sacrifice everything within our power, we can promise the people nothing but blood, toil, tears, and sweat. The red dawn shall ensure both warmth and unity, destroying any capitalists who dare try and destabilise our glorious nation!

name: Governmental Reform
description: As it stands the current bureaucratic system is oversized, especially considering the size of [SIA.GetSIAshortname]. Not only does this make it inefficient but it also continues to drain a larger portion of our budget as the years pass. Undertaking reformation should be a top priority.

name: Judicial Reform
description: While the archaic Ayutthayan era laws are no longer in place we must regain the jurisdiction rights we lost after the ratification of the Bowring Treaty, in order to boost our prestige worldwide. By doing so, we will make our judicial system much more effective.

name: Centralised Police Command
description: Following the Weltkrieg our police command has become paralysed as it is comprised of a mix of German, Italian, and American employees. By slowly replacing them with [SIA.GetAdjective] graduates, and merging the metropolitan and regional police command, we can ensure greater efficiency from our police force.

name: [SIA.GetSIAintAgencyName]
description: The '[SIA.GetSIAshortname] Department of Secret Intelligence' (also known as the Samnak Khaokrong Haeng Chart) shall ensure the maintenance of stability throughout the nation by handling and keeping track of both domestic and foreign intelligence.

name: National Curriculum Act
description: While Rama V and Rama VI enacted laws in favour of bringing education to [SIA.GetSIAshortname], we should begin to focus on the quality of this education. Primary education shall now be lengthened to six years while education shall be made compulsory until Grade 12. Harmful material, such as syndicalist or separatist propaganda, shall also be heavily monitored.

name: Creation of Regional Universities
description: In order to support our nation we must first create a strong educational foundation. Through the creation of regional universities, in Chian Mai, Khonkaen, and Hat Yai (Songkhla), higher education will be made more affordable for people who live far away from Bangkok.

name: King Mongkut's Institute of Technology
description: Named after a [SIA.GetAdjective] king, who was known for his monumental scientific feats, this specialised research facility shall vastly increase our research capability while also harnessing the top minds [SIA.GetSIAshortname] has to offer.

name: Initial Economic Stabilisation
description: Following the immediate aftermath of the economic crisis, which has been dubbed Black Monday, it has been made clear that there are many weaknesses within our economy and that we must take steps to remedy the situation.

name: Kickstart Local Businesses
description: Through providing local businesses with government loans, or assisting them with whatever else they may need, we can ensure that economic activity within our country occurs not only on the national scale but on the local scale as well.

name: Bailout [SIA.GetSIAcementcorp]
description: By providing bailouts to [SIA.GetSIAcementcorp], the largest cement and building material company in [SIA.GetName], we can ensure that the company stays afloat and avoid any further negative impacts on our economy.

name: The Petrochemical Department
description: By creating a new authority for the extraction of coal, oil, lignite and tar we can ensure that the process of refining and processing of petroleum is better managed and more efficiently carried out.

name: Chiang Mai Oil Discovery
description: Crude oil was first discovered in the Fang district, specifically Chiang Mai, in 1921 but was never properly exploited. The current economic crisis has driven up the price to record levels and any instability in the region might cut us off from our imported sources in Palembang. Becoming more self-reliant may well help improve our struggling industrialisation as well.

name: Rayong Refineries
description: Formerly the 'Department of Fuel Acquisition' in the Ministry of Defence, a newly created state-owned enterprise will ensure that the oil within our nation is better managed and that we can more effectively refine what we drill.

name: New Construction Methods
description: By adopting new construction methods we can work towards the gradual industrialisation and economic development of [SIA.GetName].

name: Contracts with Chaiseri
description: Founded as a civilian truck part company, Chaiseri has gained some insights into heavy machinery production and wants us to fund their armoured car project as a testbed for future combat vehicles.

name: Southern Rubber Plantations
description: Exploitation of the rubber plantations in the south should be considered a vital national industry in this day and age, and can help us stimulate trade as nations around the world look for sources beyond Singapore.

name: Thairung's [SIA.GetAdjective] Cars
description: By investing in new car models we can promote personal mobility and develop vehicles for military use.

name: Prototype Tank Design
description: We must bringtogether all of the brilliant military minds that [SIA.GetSIAshortname] possesses and fund the creation of a prototype tank design, harkening back to the prototype built during Rama VI's reign, to help stimulate our armaments industry while also gaining an edge over any potential enemies.

name: Deal with Sahaviriya Steel
description: By negotating a deal with Sahaviriya Steel, we can better manage the steel output within our nation and gain more control over what goes where, while also insulating against foreign entryism. This will also assist in job creation efforts.

name: Tungsten Mines in Nakhon Si Thammarat
description: Tungsten is an incredibly crucial resource that allows for production of modern electronics and the creation of new industrial tools.

name: Exploit Kanchanaburi's Iron Reservoir
description: Exploiting the 'iron reservoir' in Kanchanaburi will provide a vital source of iron for the nation's strategic interests and help to galvanise the growth of domestic steel.

name: Expand the Loei Iron Mines
description: Expanding the iron mines in Loei should be a top priority, as productive of iron ore and steel is vital to a modern economy. Additionally this will help to reduce unemployment and keep people working.

name: Tiger Club Economy
description: Through our policy of economic revitalisation via investment into key industries, alongside new research methods, we have managed to massively increase the wealth of our people and the nation.

name: Agricultural Mechanisation
description: Rice paddy uses over half of the arable land in [SIA.GetName], yet it consists mainly of peasants farming small areas and producing modest amounts of rice. By providing cheap, low-interest loans for the purchase of tractors and modern equipment we can free some of these farmers from the ricefields and send them to the factories instead, without compromising crop yields.

name: Agricultural Co-operatives
description: While the first [SIA.GetAdjective] co-op was created back in 1916, co-ops themselves aren't a common sight among rural communities yet. By persuading rice farmers to pool their savings together and organize into co-ops they will have enough money to buy the badly needed farming equipment in these hard times, and obtain greater bargaining power against the rice merchants.

name: A Communal Approach
description: Rice is central to [SIA.GetAdjective] society. Our farmers have long resisted to government intervention and embraced egalitarian methods, exchanging labour with other farmers to cover their needs. By focusing on these aspects of [SIA.GetAdjective] society and encouraging further community cooperation we can build a better country, while guarding against aristocrats and landlords.

name: Model Farm Initiative
description: By creating 'Model Farms' throughout the country, where rice farmers can study new farming techniques and crop diversification, farmers can improve how they utilize their lands and thus greatly increase output.

name: Economic Self-Sufficiency
description: Our plans to boost rice cultivation have worked incredibly well so far, and a dizzying amount agricultural surplus is available. We can now fully focus on our industrialisation plan.

name: Export-Oriented Rice Production
description: Rice is central to [SIA.GetAdjective] society. Rice production normally does not ammount to much more than the farmer needs to survive, leaving very little to profit from. If necessary we can colaborate with large rice merchants and mills to supply a market pressure for more production, or we can simply obligate the farmers to produce more by increasing their rice tax.

name: Rice Subsidy Scheme
description: By creating incentives for those farmers who have accomplished huge increases in their rice output and allowing peasants to own the land they've cleared for agricultural purposes we can provide simple market incentives to cultivate more land and increase crop yields.

name: Granary of the World
description: We're now one of the largest rice exporters in the world, even if the peasantry do feel a touch exploited.

name: National Highway Commission
description: The expansion of Route 3 (Sukhumvit Road: Bangkok - Rayong) and Route 1 (Vachiravut Road: Bangkok - Lopburi) has been considered by the government for some time now - with the creation of the National Highway Commission perhaps things will progress more smoothly.

name: [SIA.GetSIAprefixEN] [SIA.GetAdjective] Air Corps
description: First founded in 1913 as the Royal Flying Corps, our flyboys have helped us achieve numerous victories by assisting us from the sky. We will therefore once again rename the [SIA.GetSIAprefixEN] [SIA.GetAdjective] Aeronautical Service to the [SIA.GetSIAprefixEN] [SIA.GetAdjective] Air Corps.

name: Airport Authority of [SIA.GetSIAshortname]
description: Construction of additional state-owned airports can help us kick-start our own national carrier airline and serve as airbases for our Air forces.

name: Air Raid Preparations
description: Luang Athuekthewadet's has conducted a conclusive study: creation of a dedicated anti-air defence corps wil help safeguard the capital and other place of importance from enemy aerial attacks.

name: [SIA.GetAdjective] Aviation Industries
description: By investing in [SIA.GetAdjective] Aviation Industries ([SIA.GetSIAairIndustryAcronym]), previously in charge of our Air force maintenance, they will be able to contribute more to the war effort with their own locally-designed planes.

name: New Fighter Design
description: Our own Prajadhipok fighter has been proved to be obsolete for modern war. Under Luang Wechayanrangsarit's leadership our design bureau will help us create the much needed air power.

name: Naval Bomber Focus
description: Being between the Indian and Pacific ocean and with a long coastline it makes perfect sense to develop specialised naval bombers..

name: Tactical Bomber Development
description: Our own Boripatr bombers, designed by Luang Wechayanrangsarit, served well as testbed aircraft for our own design bureau but not in actual combat. Let us use our own know-how to design proper bombers suited for modern combat.

name: Close Air Support Focus
description: Our own fighter and bomber support on the ground has proved to be inadequate - maybe a dedicated CAS plane with both mobility and proper armament is needed?

name: Continued Air Development
description: With its increasing importance out air force needs to continue to develop its combat tactics, to be better prepared for the future.

name: Protectors of the Sky
description: Like Garuda we shall be one of the best air force in the region, with power to swiftly go anywhere. Ever watchful and an enemy of those who dare to attack us.

name: [SIA.GetSIAprefixEN] [SIA.GetAdjective] Navy
description: Established in 1887, the [SIA.GetSIAnavyName] has similar organisational structures to the United States Navy, since it is composed of both the naval fleet and the [SIA.GetSIAprefixEN] [SIA.GetAdjective] Marine Corps. It was also the second Asian nation to acquire submarines, after Japan.

name: Expand Sattahip
description: Sattahip was first built as the [SIA.GetSIAnavyName]'s main naval base back in 1914. As the base is quite small and already reaching its support capacity limit, expansion of its facilities is definitely in order.

name: Chonburi-Class Destroyers
description: Named after late Admiral Prince Abhakara Kiartivongse, Prince of Chumphon, these new destroyer design will serve well as the backbone of our [SIA.GetSIAprefixTH]navi.

name: The S-Ships Project
description: These 'Ruea-Sor's were first envisioned by late Mahidol Adulyadej, Prince of Songkhla, who studied at the Marineschule MÃ¼rwik, as 'essential' to the defence of Bangkok and by extension the Gulf of [SIA.GetSIAshortname]. While we have procurred four small submarines for the first line of defence; continuing the second phase of the plan, which entails another 5 submarines for the outer defensive line, might be a good idea.

name: Convoy Hunting
description: Being surrounded by bigger and more heavily armed navy, Admiral Luang Yutthasart Kosol suggests we play hide-and-seek with the enemy fleet instead of facing them head-on. All the while sniping them from afar with our torpedoes.

name: Coastal Defence Ships
description: While these heavily armed cruisers are no match against German East Asiaflotte or Imperial Japanese Navy, and have limited capability in the high seas, they will surely serve our cash-strapped navy well, especially in the island-dotted coastal waters of both the Gulf of [SIA.GetSIAshortname] and the Andaman Sea.

name: A New Flagship
description: As we are seriously outgunned by our neighbours having something that can reliably punch through battleship armour might be a good idea. This will also provide our seamen a sense of pride and accomplishment.

name: Fleet in Being
description: Being surrounded by bigger and more heavily armed navy, Admiral Luang Kamolnavin wants us to get all the firepower we can get to knock the enemy battleships out of the fight and, if possible, sink them.

name: A Two-Ocean Navy
description: Our navy is perhaps too small to face the Kaiserliche Marine or the IJN head-on. Some additional funding would definitely help.

name: Expand the Navikkayothin Corps
description: Although 'Taharn Ma-Rine' were first founded back in 1833, the unit served mostly as a royal honour guard throughout the 19th century. It wasn't until 1913 that the [SIA.GetSIAprefixEN] [SIA.GetAdjective] Marine Corps were reorganized into the modern "Navy Amphibious Assault Group" who saw some action back in the Weltkrieg. Perhaps the marines can serve as yet another ace in the hole for the upcoming conflict?

name: River Patrol Units
description: Both the Salween and Mekong rivers serve as our natural fortification against enemy advances. By sending our promising junior captains to learn from their brown water counterparts they can learn a lesson or two about naval organisation.

name: Improved Landing Craft
description: The [SIA.GetSIAprefixEN] [SIA.GetAdjective] Marine Corps currently use ex-British merchant ships we seized back in the Weltkreig as their only mean of transportation. Having dedicated amphibious landing ships will make sure that our boys can embark and secure the beachhead faster.

name: [SIA.GetSIAprefixEN] [SIA.GetAdjective] Army
description: First formed in 1874, as a response to new security threats brought in by the 1855 Bowing treaty (which opened us to international trade) - the army is the oldest and largest branch in the [SIA.GetSIAprefixEN] [SIA.GetAdjective] Armed Forces, fulfilling its role as the protector of our sovereignty.

name: Phibunsongkhram's Reforms
description: The [SIA.GetName] will adopt a doctrine based on the advice of Luang Phibunsongkhram. Being well known for his translation of a French Weltkrieg-era Field Artillery manual into Thai, he advocates for a centralized and well-equiped army with the usage of artillery being the main focus.

name: Seriroengrit's Reforms
description: The [SIA.GetName] will follow the advice of Luang Seriroengrit, the leader of the Phayap Army who fought off numerous cross-border raids from Burma post-British Revolution. His doctrine emphasizes the usage of a decentralized regional army command, composed mainly by militias. Similar to that of Switzerland.

name: Phahonpolpayuhasena's Plan
description: The [SIA.GetName] will adopt the proposals of Phraya Phahonpolpayuhasena. Studies at the Hauptkadettenanstalt during his younger years and experience of the German General Staff's work during the Weltkrieg have convinced him that proper planning is the key to victoy.

name: Suranaree Battalion
description: While 'Ja-Khlone', female palace guards, have been a common sight in the inner palace since the Ayutthayan era having female soldiers in active combat is on another level altogether. Luang Phibunsongkhram himself has voiced limited support for the petition, but the question is still up in the air. Persuing such measures is sure to anger traditionalists.

name: New Standard Rifle
description: The old Type 46 Siamese Mauser is prone to malfunction in our hot and humid climate, perhaps it's time to get a replacement?

name: Artillery Research Divisions
description: Lead by Luang Wichitsongkhram, the new artillery research division is responsible for designing our own native artillery to reduce the demand for imported artillery in the army.

name: Defence Technology Institute
description: Satisfied with their most recent project; the old artillery research division will now be expanded and put in charge of other fields of military research, ensuring our armed forces at the cutting edge.

name: Electronics Research
description: The Advent of 'Khanittakorn', a computing device made by Tanin Industry, will tremendously help our war efforts.

name: Project Phi Fa
description: Inspired by the Laotian "Bun Bang Fai" festival in Isan, proper research and development might be able to turn these homemade rockets into dreadful killing weapons and engines to power our aircraft.

name: Jungle Combat Training
description: The harsh jungles of Indochina have long been a graveyard of empires, friend and foe alike. We must train all our troops to better operate in such hostile conditions.

name: Asymmetrical Warfare
description: By analyzing the tactics employed by the Vietnamese in the Saigon Uprising -which quickly became the Indochinese Rebellion- and some of Luang Chumnanyutthasart's exploits in Shan back in 1928, we can gain some insight into effective placement of troops and how to fight in urban terrain.

name: The National Reserve Act
description: "...All men aged between 18-45 with [SIA.GetAdjective] citizenship are required to be registered at their local barracks and finish their basic trainig course at least once, not doing so can result in being court marshalled by the Army..."\n\n-excerpt from 2484 B.E. the National Reserve Bill

name: Expand Support Team Capacity
description: 'Taharn Chang' (Combat Engineers) and 'Taharn Khonsong' (Logistics Teams) are what kept our army working for so long during the Weltkrieg, let's give them better tools so that they can fulfil their role in a modern war.

name: For the Motherland!
description: Our ancestors have shed so much blood on this piece of land now called [SIA.GetSIAshortname], we shall make sure that their sacrifices aren't in vain.

name: Army Reorganisation
description: Our army currently uses various rifle and artillery models, which has proved to be a logistical nightmare. By adopting a unified ammunition size for each gun type and phasing the old ones out, or rechambering them to fire the new 8x52mmR Siamese rimmed catridge, we will considerably help our supply issues.

name: Integration of the Police Command
description: Police General Phao Sriyanond suggests that we should elevate the police force to the same level as the other 3 branches of the [SIA.GetSIAprefixEN] [SIA.GetAdjective] Armed Forces. This will result in a more efficent organisation in case of emergency and extra funding for the underarmed police forces, but will also involve them taking a much larger cut of our tax money than ever before.

name: Taharn Pran
description: Also known as '[SIA.GetAdjective] Rangers' in English, Taharn Pran is a paramilitary light infantry unit of the [SIA.GetSIAprefixEN] [SIA.GetAdjective] Army composed of volunteers who are trained to patrol the borders. They act as a quick response force in case of foreign invasion. Local volunteers also make sure that we aill always have the terrain advantage over the enemy.

name: Counter-Insurgency Tactics
description: Our Taharn Pran units have shown some success in detecting enemy infiltration on our border, perhaps they can also act as our eyes and ears in occupied zones too?

name: Chulachomklao [SIA.GetSIAprefixEN] Military Academy
description: By merging the Royal Military Academy (est. 1887) with the [SIA.GetSIAprefixEN] [SIA.GetAdjective] Army Polytechniques Institute, the newly-named Chulachomklao [SIA.GetSIAprefixEN] Military Academy should get better results as their funding will be streamlined and more efficient.

name: [SIA.GetSIAprefixEN] Munitions Factory
description: Having enemies on all sides, [SIA.GetSIAshortname] nearly used up all her artillery shells during the Weltkrieg, with no means of being freshly supplied. This has resulted in a massive supply of artilery shells being hoarded by the paranoid logistics department over the years, but additional ammunition factories would definitely help us in the event of prolonged conflict.

name: Industrial Mobilisation Plan
description: In the times of war, key industries will temporary be put under governemnt control to ensure our nation's survival. While this has proved to be unpopular, it will keep our army adequately armed and increase our chance of winning this war.

name: Special Warfare Command
description: Modelled after the German Luftlandetruppe and the Austrian Gebirgstruppe, 'Krom Songkhram Pisaet' will be responsbile for recruiting and training our new specialized units capable of disrupting the enemy from behind their lines.
